concise_definition: v. 淹死, 淹没 (die by submersion in water)

definitions.explanation_en: To die as a result of being submerged in water or another liquid, preventing the ability to breathe.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因被水或其他液体淹没而导致窒息死亡。
definitions.example_en: The child drowned in the river after falling off the bridge.
definitions.example_cn: 孩子从桥上掉入河中，不幸溺水身亡。

definitions.explanation_en: To overwhelm or cover completely with a liquid, often metaphorically, such as emotions or sounds.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指被液体完全覆盖，也可用于比喻，如被情绪、声音等淹没。
definitions.example_en: The auditorium was drowned in applause after the performance.
definitions.example_cn: 演出结束后，礼堂里响起了雷鸣般的掌声。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause something to be submerged or lost beneath a surface, especially water, often implying destruction or disappearance.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指使某物被淹没或沉入表面之下，尤指被水淹没，常暗示毁灭或消失。
definitions.example_en: The ancient city was drowned beneath the reservoir when the dam was built.
definitions.example_cn: 大坝建成后，这座古城被水库淹没。

comparison.analysis: “Suffocate” (窒息) 指因缺氧而死亡，原因不限于水，也可能由烟雾、气体或压迫胸部引起。它强调呼吸受阻的生理机制，而 “drowned” 特指因液体进入呼吸道导致的窒息死亡。
“Submerge” (淹没) 是一个中性动词，仅表示某物被液体覆盖，不必然导致死亡或破坏。例如潜艇下潜或物体被水淹没。而 “drowned” 隐含了致命后果，专用于生命体因淹没而死亡的情形。
“Overwhelm” (压倒) 是一个更广泛的比喻性动词，可用于情绪、任务、信息等抽象事物的压倒性冲击。虽然 “drowned in emotion” 是一种比喻用法，但 “overwhelm” 更强调心理或情感上的不堪重负，而 “drowned” 在比喻中更侧重于被彻底吞没、失去控制的意象。
